citeinfo.origin: DOGGR GIS Unit, Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, California Deparment of Conservation
citeinfo.title: California Oil and Gas Wells

descript.abstract: The California Department of Conservation, Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources publishes a GIS feature class of well locations and its associated records across the state for use by the public. Data provided are projected in Teal Albers California North American Datum of 1983 for shapefiles and WGS84 Web Mercator projection for web feature service. Well Attributes include API Number, Lease Name, Well Number, Well Status, Well Type, Operator Code, Operator Name, Field Name, Area Name, District, County, Section, Township, Range, Base Meridian, Latitude, Longitude, GISSource, Confidential Well, Directionally Drilled, Spud Date,WellSymbol. Well location values were collected using a submeter-accurate gps receiver (i.e., Trimble GeoXT). Some of the data provided herein are also displayed in the Division's WellFinder application (http://maps.conservation.ca.gov/doggr/index.html).
descript.purpose: This feature class contains an up-to-date oil and gas wells data compiled by the Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, California Department of Conservation.

timeperd.current: Data are oil and gas wells records from the period of 1960's to present.

idinfo.useconst: Data may change without notice. The State of California and the Resources Agency make no representations or warranties regarding the accuracy of data. The user will not seek to hold the State or the Agency liable under any circumstances for any damages with respect to any claim by the user or any third party on account of or arising from the use of data. The user will cite the Resource Agency and/or the appropriate Department within the Agency as the original source of the data, but will clearly denote cases where the original data have been updated, modified, or in any way altered from the original condition. There are no restrictions on distribution of the data by users. For further information or to make suggestions about the data, contact the Division of Oil, Gas, and Geothermal Resources, 801 K Street, MS 20-20, Sacramento, CA 95814-3530. If you have any questions or concerns email DOGGRGISUNIT@conservation.ca.gov.

cntorgp.cntorg: Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, California Deparment of Conservation

idinfo.datacred: California Department of Conservation, Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources

enttyp.enttypd: California oil and gas wells point feature class

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: API Number. Unique and permanent identifier assigned to each well as standardized by the American Petroleum Institute
Lease name of oil and gas wells. At situation when lease name of that well is unknown, the location in which well is located (i.e. section, township, range, longitude, latitude) is then recorded.
Operator-assigned alpha numeric designation for well.

Well Status - single code identifying current status of well. Single code stands for: A = Active (well has been drilled and completed) C = Cancelled (well permit has been cancelled, no well has been drilled) I = Idle (well is idle, not producing at certain period but capable of being reactivated) N = New (recently permitted well; in the process of being drilled) P = Plugged & Abandoned (well has been plugged and abandoned to current standards) U = Unknown (well status not known; mostly older wells dated on pre-1976)
Name of the oil and gas field in which the well is located
Name of area in which well is located
DOGGR district with jurisdiction over the location in which well is located
County with jurisdiction over the location in which well is located
Public Land Survey System section number in which well is located
Public Land Survey System township in which well is located
Public Land Survey System range in which well is located
Longitude of well in the NAD83 coordinate system; decimal degree format
Longitude of well in the NAD83 coordinate system; decimal degree format

3-character code describing the method by which the well location was established (Ranked from most accurate to least accurate) GPS = Global Positioning System (Coordinates derived from Division staff and Trimble GPS unit) OPR = Operator (Coordinates provided by Operator via electronic format; ex. Excel, db, etc.) SUM = Well Summary Report (Coordinates provided by Operator, post-drilling, on SUM) NOI = Notice of Intent to Drill (Coordinates provided by Operator, pre-drilling, on NOI) DOQ = Digital Ortho Quad (Coordinates derived from aerial imagery) MIP = MapInfo Plotted (Coordinates generated from tool in MapInfo using corner call locations) HUD = Heads Up Digitized (Coordinates derived from scanned, georeferenced Mylar maps)
Date on which well drilling commenced

cntorgp.cntorg: Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, California Deparment of Conservation

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The California Department of Conservation, Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources publishes a GIS feature class of well locations and its associated records across the state for use by the public. Data provided are projected in Teal Albers California North American Datum of 1983 for shapefiles and WGS84 Web Mercator projection for web feature service. Well Attributes include API Number, Operator Well Number, Well Status, Well Type, Operator Code, Operator Name, Lease Name, Field Name, Area Name, District, County, Section, Township, Range, Base Meridian, Latitude, Longitude, Elevation, Total Depth, Redrill Footage, Redrill Cancel Flag, Location Description, Comments, GIS Source, Dry Hole, Confidential Well, Directionally Drilled, Hydraulically Fractured, BLM Well, EPA Well, Spud Date, Completion Date, Abandoned Date.Well location values were collected using a submeter-accurate gps receiver (i.e., Trimble GeoXT). Some of the data provided herein are also displayed in the Division's WellFinder application (http://maps.conservation.ca.gov/doggr/index.html).
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This feature class contains an up-to-date oil and gas wells data compiled by the Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources, California Department of Conservation.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: California Department of Conservation, Division of Oil, Gas and Geothermal Resources

The user will cite the Resource Agency and/or the appropriate Department within the Agency as the original source of the data, but will clearly denote cases where the original data have been updated, modified, or in any way altered from the original condition. There are no restrictions on distribution of the data by users.

dataExt.exDesc: Data are oil and gas wells records from the period of 1960's to present.
